GridSolver.java

Author:

Field Summary
private  Grid gridObj
          Represents a sudoku grid.
private  byte[] mData
          Each index corresponds with a possible sudoku entry in the grid.
private  byte[] mDataSolution
          Stores the solution to the sudoku grid, if no solution is found then it is filled with zeros.
private  byte[] mDataTemp
          Stores data for the current grid being evaluated.
private  int mNumClues
          The number of clues initially given.
private  int mSize
          The number of columns, rows, and subgrids in the grid.
private  int mTotalSize
          The number of cells in the grid.

          Calculates the number of initial clues given in the grid.
(package private)  void formatGridData()
          Overwrites any value that is not a clue with a 0 and also fills the solution container with zeros.

makeDataSolution

void makeDataSolution()
Makes an absolute value copy of the solution. This is only called if a solution was found.

formatGridData

void formatGridData()
Overwrites any value that is not a clue with a 0 and also fills the solution container with zeros.

Uses brute force and backtracking to find a solution to the grid.
